title: Hair-Original broadway cast 1968 RCA Victor release
description:
Hair, The American Tribal Love Rock Musical

RCA Victor Dynagroove, LSO-1150 STEREO, issued 1968.

Ripped from the original vinyl. Included images of the album jacket and the vinyl center labels. 

I listened to a 1988 CD reissue on BMG [Catalog # 1150-2-RC], and it sounded too different to me. There were added songs, and one song out of sequence. 

I want as close to the same experience, on a computer or CD, that I had when I listened to this album on vinyl, over and over, in 1970 when I was 15 years old. To me, these ripped tracks sound superior to the re-mastered CD I heard, and the pops and the warmth of the sound of vinyl are priceless.

To listen like a vinyl album, load all the Side 1 tracks and play, then get out of your seat, and like turning over the album back in the day, load the Side 2 tracks and cool out. (Alternately, play in Winamp, load up Milkdrop, and trip out)

When you burn to CD, select ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½no pause between tracksÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ for the total vinyl experience.

Ripped from the original 1968 vinyl to FLAC. 
(Stanton STR8-30 Direct Drive Turntable, Onkyo TX-8011 Stereo Receiver, M-Audio MobilePre USB, Nero WaveEditor, no filters used)
